jobDescription: A Manager in Tax Quality and Risk Management (TQRM Manager) within the National Office of Risk Management (NORM) assists in addressing tax quality, risk management, and professional standards matters in the RSM US LLP tax practice. A TQRM Manager will report to a partner or a senior manager in Tax Quality and Risk Management.  As part of the TQRM team, the Manager will be responsible for: Assist in addressing tax quality, risk management, and professional standards matters within the RSM tax practiceAssist in developing and maintaining tax practice policiesDraft and maintain guidance and practice aids addressing tax quality and risk management issues and maintaining content for the Tax Policies and Ethics websiteDevelop and maintain CPE courses addressing tax quality, risk management and ethics issues and reviewing and providing TQRM content for other Tax CPE courses to present training on webcasts and at national conferencesAssist in developing and maintaining software tools used in TQRM mattersSupport others in NORM to address the application to the tax practice of regulatory and ethics issues applicable to all lines of business, including independence and data privacy and securityConsult with individual tax practitioners regarding tax policy, and tax-related professional standards, quality, and risk management issuesConsult with RSM practitioners and general counsel regarding tax-related claims, penalty assessments or ethics inquiriesManage tax services authorizations granted by Tax Local LeadersManage the annual RSM Tax Practice Review processManage reporting to tax practitioners and local and regional leadership regarding quality and risk management mattersAssist Local and Regional Tax Leaders in addressing any identified quality, ethics or risk issuesBasicQualifications:A TQRM Manager must have strong technical skills, professional credibility, the ability and willingness to take on difficult issues, and the commitment to focus on TQRM activitiesA TQRM Manager will be required to develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of RSM Tax Policies and the regulatory and ethics standards applicable to U.S. tax practice, including:-Circular 230AICPA Code of Professional ConductAICPA Statements on Standards for Tax ServicesApplicable Internal Revenue Code provisions, including §§6060, 6107, 6109, 6694, 6695, and 7216Must have an active license as a CPA or attorneyProficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint is required. Experience with Microsoft Access is helpful, but not required You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.  Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.  RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.
